summary: This bill, the Northeastern Arizona Indian Water Rights Settlement Act of 2025, aims to settle water rights claims of the Navajo Nation, the Hopi Tribe, and the San Juan Southern Paiute Tribe in Arizona. It ratifies a settlement agreement, defines terms, establishes trust funds, and allocates Arizona Colorado River water to the tribes. The bill authorizes the construction of the iiná bá – paa tuwaqat’si pipeline, details water use, storage, and leasing, and addresses environmental compliance and funding mechanisms. It also includes provisions for waivers of claims and establishes an 'Enforceability Date' contingent on certain conditions.
